meanings.definition: Curtailing: to reduce in extent or quantity
meanings.sent1: She is curtailing her spending to save money for a new bike.
meanings.sent2: The government is curtailing the use of plastic to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The chef was curtailing the amount of salt in the soup, but it ended up tasting bland.
meanings.sent4: The teacher curtailing the number of questions on the test made it easier for the students.
meanings.sent5: By curtailing the number of guests at the party, she ensured everyone had a good time.

meanings.definition: Curtailing: to cut short; bring to a premature end
meanings.sent1: The rainstorm curtailing our picnic forced us to pack up quickly.
meanings.sent2: The principal decided to curtail the school assembly due to a fire drill.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was curtailed by a mischievous monkey stealing his props.
meanings.sent4: The movie's ending was curtailing, leaving the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The power outage curtailed the concert, disappointing the audience.
